instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1989 - 820-00850 - Stucks at 5V  -> Missing PPBUS_G3H on single port
threads.message:
Hi there,

currently I'm working on a MBP A1989. It was my testing-device for repairs and ironically it just stopped working :-D
When I got it, 2 years ago, the logicboard was slightly bent on the top left corner (corner of the Touch-ID) but it worked well for two years.
Now it stucks at 5V. Im getting 5V 550mA on 3 of 4 ports. The last one is at 5.1V 170mA and PPBUS_G3H is missing on this single port. PPBUS is present when plugging it in with the other 3 ports.
Does anybody has an idea what could cause this?

Thank you very much and a happy new year to everybody :-)

threads.title: A1989 - 820-00850 - Stucks at 5V  -> Missing PPBUS_G3H on single port
threads.message:
Check PPBUS_G3H with just charger connected (no battery).
Test it out of the shell.
Use 87/96W original charger.

Also compare diode mode readings on the LDOs of bad port with any other.
PLEASE, don't make "cardinal refferences"; use corresponding component position in the boardview/schematic.

threads.title: A1989 - 820-00850 - Stucks at 5V  -> Missing PPBUS_G3H on single port
threads.message:
Thank you for your reply. The measurements were made out of the shell, without battery. I did get the same results when i initially tested it, inside the case with battery. The charger is the original one :) 

I will check on the LDOs and post the results.
Ok, sorry, I won't do it again ;-)

threads.title: A1989 - 820-00850 - Stucks at 5V  -> Missing PPBUS_G3H on single port
threads.message:
I did the measurements and found the fallowing differences between the LDOS of the bad one (UB300), compared to the others:
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOD = 0.434 is lower than the others (=0.465)
PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO   = 0.218 is much lower than the others (=0.402)

Measuremnts on PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC and PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOA are "good".

threads.title: A1989 - 820-00850 - Stucks at 5V  -> Missing PPBUS_G3H on single port
A1989 - 820-00850 - Stucks at 5V  -> Missing PPBUS_G3H on single port
threads.message: But strangely I got 3.3V on  PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO and 1.8V on  PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOD

threads.title: A1989 - 820-00850 - Stucks at 5V  -> Missing PPBUS_G3H on single port
threads.message: But i dont get  PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC, when plugged in at the corresponding port.

threads.title: A1989 - 820-00850 - Stucks at 5V  -> Missing PPBUS_G3H on single port
threads.message:
You've said to get 1V1 LDO on both chips before!
Change the chip wich doesn't generate this LDO.
